title: Fibonacci with Memoization
algorithmDescription: Calculate Fibonacci number using memoization to avoid redundant calculations
detailedDescription: Calculate the nth Fibonacci number efficiently using dynamic programming. Fibonacci sequence: 0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13... where F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2). Input: A single integer n. Output: The nth Fibonacci number. Use memoization or tabulation to achieve O(n) time complexity.
hints: Store previously computed values to avoid recomputation
Bottom-up approach: compute F(0), F(1), ..., F(n)
Space optimization: only need last two values
solutionApproach: Use bottom-up DP: initialize array with base cases F(0)=0, F(1)=1. Iterate from 2 to n, computing F(i) = F(i-1) + F(i-2). Return F(n).
testCaseCriteria: Must efficiently compute Fibonacci for values up to n=50. Should complete in reasonable time.
